The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.\nsell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.\nrearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.\nsell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.\nbuy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.\nbuy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.\nbuy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.\nbuy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.\nround_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.\nreroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.\n\n#Task\nAnalyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}
reasoning:
**My Turn in the Shop**

Okay, here we are in the Shop phase of Ante 7, Round 18, with $37 in the bank. The goal, as always, is to crush the Ante 7 boss and move on to Ante 8. I've got a solid Joker setup: Green Joker (a nice +13 Mult, Holo), Spare Trousers (+18), the Certificate, Luchador (x1.5), Constellation (currently at x3.3, which is key), and Blue Joker (+126 Chips), bringing me to 6/6 Jokers, plus a Judgement consumable.

The Shop has some interesting options. There's Smiley Face (a potential +5 Mult for face cards, which *could* be useful, but I'd have to sacrifice a strong Joker for it; probably not worth it), Pluto (a Planet card - and *very* relevant), an Arcana Pack (always a good bet for deck thinning and enhancements), and a Mega Standard Pack (for more deck tinkering).

My Pair is Level 9, Three of a Kind is Level 10, so I'm well on my way. I recently used Mercury to level up Pair and give Constellation a boost. The current strategy is centered on Constellation, which scales with Planet cards.

Aha! Pluto is the key here. Buying Pluto for a mere $3 will immediately bump Constellation up to x3.4, making it more powerful. This seems like the obvious play. I'm also considering the Arcana Pack for further deck enhancements.

The Judgment consumable is tempting, but I can't use it right now because I'm at my Joker limit. So, the play is clear: I'm going to *buy_and_use_consumable* at position [2], which is the Pluto card. This will immediately support my scaling strategy with Constellation. This is the optimal play right now. No need to overthink it - get that Pluto.
